# ğŸ¬ ThumbnailPro AI

**High-CTR YouTube Thumbnails, Generated by Gemini AI.**

ThumbnailPro AI is a professional-grade SaaS application that leverages Google's state-of-the-art **Gemini Vision** models to analyze video content and generate high-converting thumbnails in seconds.

![Project Preview](https://cdn-icons-png.flaticon.com/512/1055/1055666.png)

---

## âœ¨ Key Features

### ğŸ§  Intelligent Video Analysis
Simply paste a YouTube URL. Our engine scans the metadata and frames to understand the core narrative, ensuring your thumbnails are contextually perfect.

### ğŸ­ Dual-Mode Generation
*   **Normal Mode**: Professional, branded, and clean designs.
*   **Clickbait Mode**: High-emotion, high-contrast designs optimized for maximum CTR and emotional engagement.

### ğŸ“ Vertical Sync (16:9 & 9:16)
Generate a widescreen thumbnail and a perfectly coordinated **9:16 vertical version** for YouTube Shorts, TikTok, and Instagram Reels in one click.

### ğŸª„ Magic Editor
Don't like a specific detail? Use our natural language editor. Tell the AI to *"Add fire effects,"* *"Make the text bigger,"* or *"Change the background to a sunset,"* and watch it happen in real-time.

### ğŸ”’ Privacy-First Persistence
Your projects stay on your device. We use **High-Efficiency Smart Compression** to store your history in local storage, ensuring your work persists across reloads without ever hitting our servers.

## ğŸ› ï¸ Tech Stack

*   **Frontend**: React 19 + TypeScript + Vite
*   **AI Engine**: Google Gemini API (`gemini-2.5-flash-image`, `gemini-3-flash-preview`)
*   **Styling**: Tailwind CSS + Custom Glassmorphism UI
*   **Icons**: Lucide React
*   **Payments**: Razorpay Integration Ready

## ğŸš€ Getting Started

### 1. Prerequisites
*   [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/) (v18+)
*   A Google AI Studio [API Key](https://aistudio.google.com/)

### 2. Installation
```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/vatsal-agra/thumbnailpro-ai.git

# Navigate to the directory
cd thumbnailpro-ai

# Install dependencies
npm install
```

### 3. Environment Setup
Create a `.env` file in the root directory and add your API Key:
```env
API_KEY=your_gemini_api_key_here
```

### 4. Launch
```bash
npm run dev
```
Open `http://localhost:5173` in your browser.
